author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Eagles bring home Wingfoot Cup
text: Eagles bring home Wingfoot Cup by E. Marcel Pourtout September 30, 2015 02:20 PM | 184 views | 0 | 0 | Special PhotoThe Milton cross country team celebrating its win at the Wingfoot Classic at Sam Smith Park in Cartersville Sept. 26. slideshow The Milton High School Cross Country team won the inaugural Wingfoot Cup at the Wingfoot Cross Country Classic hosted by the Atlanta Track Club at Sam Smith Park in Cartersville Sept. 26.The Eagles’ varsity boys’ team along with the junior varsity boys and junior varsity girls’ teams won their respective competitions while the girls’ varsity team placed third.The boys’ varsity race saw Milton finish first in the team competition with 67 points followed by Marist at 70 points and Blessed Trinity with 95 points. Eagles’ senior Jack Bluth, who is undefeated this season, won the individual competition with a time of 16:45.80, defeating four state champions in the field. Bluth used a late push on the final 200 meters to pass Marist’s Frank Pittman for the victory. Pittman finished second with a time of 16:48.20. Milton’s Sam Bowers came in third with the sophomore posting a time of 17:01.40. The rest the Eagles’ racers in the competition included senior captain Matt McGorrey placing 17th, sophomore Michael Malkowski in 20th. Clay Marshall, John Fravel and Jacques Du Plessis all placed in the top-31 out of the 195 finishers.Milton’s girls’ varsity team finished third in the team competition with 122 points. Northview won the competition with 67 points while South Forsyth’s 119 points placed it second. Freshman Taylor Cushman was the highest placing Eagles’ runner in the individual competition, posting a time of 19:53.50 for 14th place. Northview’s Lindsay Billings won the event with a time of 18:25.00. Junior Marie Repasy finished in 17th for Milton while Victoria Wagner, Charlotte Matt and Emily Bowers all finished in the top-35 out of 176 finishers.Milton won the girls’ junior varsity event behind junior Brook Aumer’s winning time of 22:03.50 followed by teammate Addy Prescott’s 22:09.60 time for second place. The junior varsity boys’ race saw Milton sweep the podium with the Eagles having the top three finishers. Sophomore Ryan Beitzel placed first with an 18:12.50 time followed by Michael McCarthy in second and Valera Stettner finishing third. Milton returns to action at the Gene Mullin Invitational at Furman University in Greenville, S.C. Oct. 10. Share This Article | similar stories
